info.title: Things We Lost in the Fire

section.title: Memories
section.para: Bitching about our projects, we came to realize that all projects seem to follow a similar pattern. Higly simplified, this pattern can be explained through the below diagram.

If we reduce the number of stakeholders in a project to three only, one can state that there is always someone (or a team) in power, a team doing the technical work and consultant either providing advice or helping development.

All these stakeholders have a certain view on the project: where the resource should go, what technology or approach should be used and what the best route to success would be. Obviously the project's succes would depend on the large space where views meet.
However we came to the conclusion that this zone of succes, for various undefined reasons, often is a "hidden zone" or even a "forbidden zone".

If you're one of us - a grumpy old man, basically
No harm in being a grumpy old woman here. , with some years of angled brackets under your belt - you will recognise this diagram, nodding and bitterly thinking back in time. You will have had many experiences relating directly to this simple diagram. Memories.

This is a paper about those memories. We'll go through some of our memories, reliving the key points, bitching about what we went through while thinking - hoping, even - that you'll be nodding right along with us.
